author: GamingBolt
description:
There’s a lot to love about The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered, from the surprisingly comprehensive changes and improvements that it makes to the 2006 original to how faithfully it still manages to recreate the original classic’s biggest strengths even with all the modernization changes it makes. 

But for all of its strengths, Oblivion Remastered still leaves a lot to be desired in the optimization department. On top of glitches related to the visuals, audio, AI, user interface, and more, the game is also unfortunately blemished by significant and consistent performance issues that can make even moment to moment gameplay quite frustrating, especially on a large number of PC builds. 

Here, we discuss all of that and more.
title: What The HELL Is Going On With The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered On PC?

author: GamingBolt
description:
DOOM: The Dark Ages is the next big game that 2025 is ready to serve up, and boy is it looking like one that is going to be worth keeping an eye on. Id Software is winding the clock back for a prequel story that sees the Doom Slayer brutally navigating a medieval war against his enemies, this time with an expanded focus on exploration, and slower (yet no less aggressive) combat. 

In the lead up to the shooter’s launch, plenty of new details have been released by id Software and Bethesda, and here, we are going to go a few more of these crucial details that you should know about.
title: DOOM: The Dark Ages - 15 NEW DETAILS You Need To Know Before You Buy
